Well usually with picking a counter, it's something that puts your champ at an advantage.
e.g. Fizz counters Aurelion Sol, because he can get easily within the stars and stay there, both nullifying Sol's damage, and giving Fizz the advantage of CQB.

But with Zed the only way you 'counter' him, is by managing not to die to his ult _(Kayle/Lissandra/Fizz/Zhonyas etc)_. but the thing is: that doesn't put you at an _advantage_ against him, it just removes _his_ advantage. So any 'counter' for Zed isn't actually _countering_ him, it just evens the playing field.

So the worst matchup for Zed is a champ that goes even with him...

So dumb.

If you're a melee assassin who gets kills instantly by jumping on peoples faces, you should be able to be hard-harassed in lane. But instead he is the one with the harass.

And not only that, once the harass is complete he gets the choice of switching in and finishing you off if you're low enough, or just staying back and doing nothing. Most champs have to make that decision before doing damage. 

Please forgive the ranting! 
I just hate champs that have everything given to them so easily. 
I play so many champs that have very high power, but just as high trade offs, and it sucks to see champs like Zed with literally no trade offs for their power.

Nocturne counters Zed
I know Nocturne is mostly used in jungle, but you can play him in mid lane.
Zed will most likely not stand a chance against Nocturne, unless if you play Nocturne very wrong.
To use Nocturne to counter Zed, start E, even though this isn't Nocturne's frequent starting ability.
Whenever Zed tries to last hit your minions, scare him away using your E.
In level 2, get Q.
Once you get to level 3, if Zed tries to harass you, use W to block his abilities, then use E to scare him away, then use Q and catch up on him, hopefully you will be able to kill him.
Once Zed gets to level 6, provided that you are level 6 as well, use W to block Zed's ult, then E him, then Q him and chase him, after that you ult him, and you should be able to kill him.
On the contrary, if you do play Zed in pvp and you met a Nocturne mid, you should call ganks for help because you may not be able to kill him on your own.

counterplay would be a) not running deathfire on ahri b) exhaust on ahri is practically mandatory into zed, makes it pretty hard to die coupled with your ult c) counter roaming so that he doesnt get a large mid game lead

if zed was as strong as you seem to think he is, then he would probably see more than 0 play in the competitive scene; hes just good at snowballing with a lead, which he gets easily against weak players

His ult always places him behind you. So {{champion:74}} (for example) just throws a grenade at his feet and his turrets do the rest. There's not much a Zed can do against it. Unless Zed is experienced enough against Heimerdinger. But then again, who is?

I'm a Heimerdinger main, and Zed is a relatively easy matchup. The main problem is the rest of your team (particularly bot lane) not backing off when you ping MIA.

However, I do agree that his kit is quite overloaded and his numbers could use some tweaking until Riot finds a suitable way to deal with him. The main issue with Zed is that he is very complicated. People learning to play him will most likely do terribly (unless they have a few good games or he just suits their playstyle) compared to high-level, experienced Zed players. I, for one, can't play Zed at all. I'm a terrible Zed player. I've seen many amazing Zed players that kick my ass, but I've also annihilated my fair share of Zeds.

All I'm trying to say is that Zed takes a lot of time and effort in order to get right consistently. Riot wants to reward players that are willing to put in that time and effort by letting them get away with stuff that most other champs couldn't. While his ultimate certainly is strong, there is still counterplay (especially as any champ with cc that can just bait out his ult and use the cc when he becomes targetable again ({{champion:74}}, {{champion:1}}, {{champion:90}}, {{champion:92}}, {{champion:61}}, just to name a few).

However, the same cannot be said about Fizz...

How to play zed

Hit lvl 6
Roam botlane
Roam botlane again 
1 more time

Now enjoy your free win
